pullRequest.body:
Add two simple results on graph colorings with Ï‡(G) colors.
1. If r â‰¤ Ï‡(G) and C is an r-coloring of G then C is surjective
2. If G has an Î±-coloring then Ï‡(G) = |Î±| iff every such coloring is surjective.

---

nodes.body:
Thanks for looking at this and for your suggestions! 

Can I just check I've understood what you mean by

> Your second theorem is just a combination of an inequality and the fact that `G.Colorable n` implies `n â‰¤ G.chromaticNumber`

By second theorem do you mean `theorem chromaticNumber_eq_card_iff_forall_surj`?

Also,  I don't see how `G.Colorable n` implies `n â‰¤ G.chromaticNumber`?
Yes. Sorry I meant it implies `G.chromaticNumber â‰¤ n`

@YaelDillies I've tried to incorporate your suggestions.

I'm not sure the 2nd result is worth having, but I've left it in for now as :

`theorem le_chromaticNumber_iff_forall_surj (C : G.Coloring (Fin n)) :
    n â‰¤ G.chromaticNumber â†” âˆ€ C : G.Coloring (Fin n), Function.Surjective C `
Sorry, I'd misunderstood your earlier suggestion, I've now incorporated it.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
Thanks!
